intro: Hieracium incisum subsp. pseudomurrianum, commonly known as the Murrian's devil's-bit. This subspecies is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy stems. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. The leaves are typically lobed and have a rough texture, while the flowers are arranged in a composite head. It is a perennial plant that thrives in temperate climates and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
